question: Which Indian Public sector banking launched ‘Start-up Banking’ initiative?
explanation:
India’s leading Public sector bank, Bank of Baroda launched Start-up Banking’ initiative, to connect with start-up firms across the country.
The initiative, which was launched simultaneously across 15 cities in the country, was inaugurated by Finance Secretary Rajiv Kumar. This initiative aims to connect with at least 2000 start ups and will offer customised products like corporate credit cards, efficient payment gateways to them.
